detaileddescription.para: By convention we always define this_type in AbcGeom classes. Used by unspecified-bool-type conversion below
The default constructor creates an empty ICurvesSchema ...

memberdef.argsstring: (CPROP_PTR iParent, const std::string &iName, const Abc::Argument &iArg0=Abc::Argument(), const Abc::Argument &iArg1=Abc::Argument())
memberdef.name: ICurvesSchema

detaileddescription.para: This templated, explicit function creates a new scalar property reader. The first argument is any Abc (or AbcCoreAbstract) object which can intrusively be converted to an CompoundPropertyReaderPtr to use as a parent, from which the error handler policy for inheritance is also derived. The remaining optional arguments can be used to override the ErrorHandlerPolicy and to specify schema interpretation matching.
This constructor is the same as above, but with default schema name used.

memberdef.argsstring: (CPROP_PTR iThis, Abc::WrapExistingFlag iFlag, const Abc::Argument &iArg0=Abc::Argument(), const Abc::Argument &iArg1=Abc::Argument())
memberdef.name: ICurvesSchema

detaileddescription.para: Return the topological variance. This indicates how the mesh may change.
Ask if we're constant - no change in value amongst samples, regardless of the time sampling.
Reset returns this function set to an empty, default state.
Valid returns whether this function set is valid.
